trans-unit.source: Copies the EFS metadata from one file or directory to another

seg-source.mrk: Copies the EFS metadata from one file or directory to another

target.mrk: Copies the EFS metadata from one file or directory to another

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The name of the file or directory from which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the file or directory from which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

target.mrk: The name of the file or directory from which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

trans-unit.source: This source file or directory must be encrypted.

seg-source.mrk: This source file or directory must be encrypted.

target.mrk: This source file or directory must be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: The name of the file or directory to which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the file or directory to which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

target.mrk: The name of the file or directory to which the EFS metadata is to be copied.

trans-unit.source: This destination file or directory does not have to be encrypted before the call to this function.

seg-source.mrk: This destination file or directory does not have to be encrypted before the call to this function.

target.mrk: This destination file or directory does not have to be encrypted before the call to this function.

trans-unit.source: If the source is a file, this parameter must also specify a file, and likewise for directories.

seg-source.mrk: If the source is a file, this parameter must also specify a file, and likewise for directories.

target.mrk: If the source is a file, this parameter must also specify a file, and likewise for directories.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies how the destination file or directory is to be opened.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies how the destination file or directory is to be opened.

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies how the destination file or directory is to be opened.

trans-unit.source: The following are the valid values of this parameter:

seg-source.mrk: The following are the valid values of this parameter:

target.mrk: The following are the valid values of this parameter:

trans-unit.source: $CREATE_NEW

seg-source.mrk: $CREATE_NEW

target.mrk: $CREATE_NEW

trans-unit.source: $CREATE_ALWAYS (Default)

seg-source.mrk: $CREATE_ALWAYS (Default)

target.mrk: $CREATE_ALWAYS (Default)

trans-unit.source: [optional] The file attributes of the destination file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The file attributes of the destination file or directory.

target.mrk: [optional]
The file attributes of the destination file or directory.

trans-unit.source: The $FILE_READ_ONLY attribute is currently not processed by this function.

seg-source.mrk: The $FILE_READ_ONLY attribute is currently not processed by this function.

target.mrk: The $FILE_READ_ONLY attribute is currently not processed by this function.

trans-unit.source: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the security attributes of the destination file or directory, if it does not already exist.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
$tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the security attributes of the destination file or directory, if it does not already exist.

target.mrk: [optional]
$tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the security attributes of the destination file or directory, if it does not already exist.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the file or directory gets a default security descriptor.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the file or directory gets a default security descriptor.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the file or directory gets a default security descriptor.

trans-unit.source: The access-control lists (ACL) in the default security descriptor for a file or directory are inherited from its parent directory.

seg-source.mrk: The access-control lists (ACL) in the default security descriptor for a file or directory are inherited from its parent directory.

target.mrk: The access-control lists (ACL) in the default security descriptor for a file or directory are inherited from its parent directory.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The caller should have the EFS key for the source file or directory, and at least the $READ_ATTRIBUTE ACL for the source file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: The caller should have the EFS key for the source file or directory, and at least the $READ_ATTRIBUTE ACL for the source file or directory.

target.mrk: The caller should have the EFS key for the source file or directory, and at least the $READ_ATTRIBUTE ACL for the source file or directory.

trans-unit.source: The specified source and destination file or directories should reside on the same computer; otherwise, the function fails.

seg-source.mrk: The specified source and destination file or directories should reside on the same computer; otherwise, the function fails.

target.mrk: The specified source and destination file or directories should reside on the same computer; otherwise, the function fails.
